intro: Aylostera huasiensis, commonly known as the Huasi's aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aylostera huasiensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
